intro: Seseli montanum, commonly known as mountain sesame, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Seseli montanum is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in cooler climates.
